page.title: 03Kingswood Farm _ Cardinham
page.content: MR and MRS Dyer and their son work on the farm. They also have 2 men to help them.The farm has 402 acres. This is a very big farm most farms in Cardinham are much smaller than this. The farm was mentoined in the original Domesday book and was farmed in strips by many farmers. The highest part of the farm is over 600' above sea level. Most of the land is used as pasture. 60 acres are used for growing barley and 20 for growing fodder beet and turnips. All of this is grown to feed the animals during the winter. About 100 acres are used to make silage and hay,also for feeding to the animals in the winter. There is also about 18 acres of oak coppice next to the forrestry land.
